solution_line_template: If Joanie wants {joanie_cups} cups, Mitchell wants {mitchell_cups} cups, Miles & Davis want {miles_davis_cups} cups and Cliff wants {cliff_cups} cups then they want {joanie_cups}+{mitchell_cups}+{miles_davis_cups}+{cliff_cups} = <<{joanie_cups}+{mitchell_cups}+{miles_davis_cups}+{cliff_cups}={total_cups_desired}>>{total_cups_desired} cups of popcorn

Every {kernels_per_batch} tablespoons makes {cups_per_batch} cups and they want {total_cups_desired} cups so {total_cups_desired}/{cups_per_batch} = <<{total_cups_desired}/{cups_per_batch}={num_batches_needed}>>{num_batches_needed} groups of {kernels_per_batch} tablespoons are needed.
Thus they need {num_batches_needed} * {kernels_per_batch} = <<{num_batches_needed}*{kernels_per_batch}={total_tablespoons_needed}>>{total_tablespoons_needed} tablespoons in total.
